page.title: 07A DAY IN SEAFORD.
page.content: EARLY IN THE MORNING THE{MILKMAN DELIVERS THE MILK, AND THE{POSTMAN DELIVERS THE MAIL AND THE{PAPER BOY DELIVERS THE PAPERS.THEN THE SHOPS START TO OPEN.THEN SOME PEOPLE GO INTO{NEWSAGENTS}TO BUY NEWSPAPERS. THEN{SCHOOLS, OFFICES AND BUSINESSES START TO OPEN.THE ROADS ARE VERY BUSY AND PEOPLE ARE HURRYING TO THE{STATION TO CATCH A TRAIN. AT NINE THIRTY THE{BANKS}OPEN. THEN THE SHOPPING AREA IS BUSY, QUEUES FORM AT{BAKERS AND GREENGROCERS.}AT LUNCH TIME FEW SHOPS CLOSE;{PUBS, CAFES AND {RESTAURANTS}SERVE MEALS OR SANDWICHES. ON{WEDNESDAY AFTERNOONS}THE SHOPS CLOSE. THE AFTERNOONS ARE LESS BUSY IN SHOPS UNTIL AFTER FOUR. ON{SUMMER DAYS MANY PEOPLE GO TO THE{BEACH. PEOPLE GO HOME FOR THE EVENING AND PUBS AND RESTAURANTS OPEN AGAIN. THE {TAKE-AWAY FOOD SHOPS}ARE POPULAR.
